intro: Machaerium mutisii, commonly known as the Andean machaerium, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are pinnately compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Machaerium mutisii is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates.
